basis: User explicitly outlines a concrete plan (300ml water, 1–2 minute box breathing, non-food coping for cravings, 5-minute target, optional shorter start if needed) and asks for guidance on progression signals. Positive and proactive tone indicates high likelihood of following through.
cognitive_dissonance: Possible mild tension between wanting to adhere to a structured plan and adjusting it in real time if it feels heavy (e.g., 5 minutes). User seeks clarity on progression signals, suggesting some internal evaluation rather than rigid adherence.
negative_thought_patterns: Occasional worry about whether the 5-minute block is sustainable; potential overemphasis on completing steps exactly as planned (risk of all-or-nothing mindset) mitigated by requests for flexible start times.
emotional_triggers: Cravings, heat/discomfort from environment, desire for control and mastery, relief from structured guidance and supportive feedback.
effective_reinforcement: Provide actionable next steps and flexible options
coaching_notes: Keep responses supportive and concrete. Confirm small-step starts (e.g., 100–150ml if needed) and relax duration as user builds comfort. Encourage post-step mood/urge logging and provide simple templates to track progress.
